replies.body: No its not just you my computer just craps out the second i click on it and i can run almost anything i want on my PC no problem.
Same here. I've got strong internet and my PC runs Skyrim and ARK on ultimate settings so I'm not sure what's going on.
Same I'm running a hard wire into my PC which is not a piece by any means and am getting ridiculous lag while my roommate on a laptop running wifi is having no issue with the site
I'm not having trouble with the website, but the gamemode itself.

It freezes when it tries to load , which is quite funny xD.. 1st time i ever see something like this happens {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} 

Tried cache diff browser its same on all regardless{{item:3157}}

This could be caused by a specific browser or browser addon, so I recommend either trying a private browsing mode (like Chrome's Incognito) or a different browser entirely. 

Let me know if either of those steps caused any change.
Happens to me too, it also uses a lot of ram. I did try on Incognito ( Chrome ) and on Microsoft Edge.

Interesting. Can you [clear your browser's cache](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752694-Clearing-Browser-History-and-Cookies) to see if this is a caching issue with the page?

Let me know if this caused a change.
Unfortunately nothing changed. Every time i open the star guardian website my computer is getting laggy.
I had the same issue. Maxxed out CPU. RAM was fine though, but that was only because I have 32GB. What processor do you have?

Same here.
If I click the link on any browser the star guardian symbol pops up then it 'freezes'.
I have to refresh to get it to animate and then it works fine.

I think it has something to do with the latest firefox update, if that's the browser you're using. When I tried going to the star guardian site on firefox, it ate so much ram and froze the computer, I had to shut my computer down. I tried it in internet explorer of all things and it worked just fine. Try a different browser maybe?
